materials.raw_text: Co: 11 g, P: 4 g, Ru: 9 g, Si: 8 g, Sm: 4 g

sourcing.instructions: Co: Purchase from a metal supplier or online chemical retailer. P: Obtain from a chemical supply store. Ru: Source from specialty metal suppliers. Si: Available at electronics or chemical supply stores. Sm: Obtain from a rare earth metal supplier.
steps: Co: Purchase from a metal supplier or online chemical retailer. P: Obtain from a chemical supply store. Ru: Source from specialty metal suppliers. Si: Available at electronics or chemical supply stores. Sm: Obtain from a rare earth metal supplier.

1. Weigh each material accurately using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry glass or ceramic container, combine Co, P, Ru, Si, and Sm in the specified amounts. 3. Use a spatula to mix the powders thoroughly until uniform in appearance. 4. Ensure there are no clumps for even distribution of materials.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each material accurately using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry glass or ceramic container, combine Co, P, Ru, Si, and Sm in the specified amounts. 3. Use a spatula to mix the powders thoroughly until uniform in appearance. 4. Ensure there are no clumps for even distribution of materials.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Preheat the furnace to 1200°C. 3. Insert the crucible and maintain this temperature for 4 hours to allow for full melting and alloying of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Preheat the furnace to 1200°C. 3. Insert the crucible and maintain this temperature for 4 hours to allow for full melting and alloying of the materials.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond file to smooth rough edges and surfaces, achieving a uniform finish. 3. If necessary, apply a sealant to enhance surface protection and prevent oxidation. 4. Allow the sealant to dry completely before handling further.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond file to smooth rough edges and surfaces, achieving a uniform finish. 3. If necessary, apply a sealant to enhance surface protection and prevent oxidation. 4. Allow the sealant to dry completely before handling further.
